CatDescriptText: Mrs. Delores Dykes, 3000 1/2 Camp Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you believe in corporal (paddling) punishment for students, in the elementary grades, who misbehave? If so, who should mete [sic]  out the punishment-- the teacher or the principal?" answer reads: �Yes, I really believe that there should be paddling, because it seems to make them behave that much better.  However, teachers should not have the authority.  It should be decided by the principal.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Delores Dykes wearing light colored trench coat with faux fur lining, plaid head scarf, and light colored gloves holding rectangular tapestry handbag, standing in front of glass block wall with Cafeteria sign
